intro: Leucocroton longibracteatus, commonly known as the long-bract leucocroton, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that consist of brightly colored cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and may have a hairy texture. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral displays.
